content:
The document provides a detailed guide on customizing TextNodes in Panda3D, covering various aspects such as font selection, styling options (including small caps), colors, shadows, cards, frames, and methods for picking text nodes. The chunk specifically focuses on setting fonts, using either .egg files or TTF fonts, and enabling small caps to customize the appearance of lowercase letters as smaller capitals. This information is part of a broader discussion on how to style and enhance TextNodes in Panda3D applications.

Font

python

cmr12 = loader.loadFont('cmr12.egg')
text.setFont(cmr12)

cpp

PT(TextFont) cmr12=FontPool::load_font("cmss12.egg");
text->set_font(cmr12);

You may use any font you like, including a TTF file; see text-fonts.

Small Caps

text.setSmallCaps(True)

python

cmr12 = loader.loadFont('cmr12.egg')
text.setFont(cmr12)

cpp

PT(TextFont) cmr12=FontPool::load_font("cmss12.egg");
text->set_font(cmr12);

setSmallCaps() accepts a boolean true or false value; set it true to enable small caps mode. In this mode, instead of rendering lowercase letters, the TextNode renders capital letters that are a bit smaller than the true capital letters. This is an especially useful feature if your font of choice doesn't happen to include lowercase letters.

You can also specify the relative scale of the "lowercase" letters:

python

text.setSmallCapsScale(0.4)

cpp

text->set_small_caps_scale(0.4);
